chapter.title: AJF - Core Reference
chapter.para: The AJF Core library provide a set of commons reusable components for use on J2EE server and other Servlet containers.

section.title: ApplicationContext
section.para:
The ApplicationContext is a component which is responsible of the application configuration. The application configuration is a set of 'properties/values' pair and is stored in the 'settings.properties' file. Some specifics properties are directly accessible attributes from ApplicationContext :
application.name log.dir working.dir
The others application attributes are available as Configuration object from ApplicationContext.getConfiguration().

example.title: Configuration file : 'settings.properties'

section.title: AuditDatas
section.para:
The AuditData object is a valu object which contain some user context informations like :
the user identifier the user transaction UUID the user transaction Date ...
'user transaction' is not in the JTA meaning but in the user requets meaning.
Normally the AuditData object is initialized automatically for the web modules with a specific ServletFilter, but you can initialize it by yourself.

section.title: Auditor
section.para:
The Auditor component allow to trace application audit informations like :
who log in the invoked action as [Function].[UnitTask] the requested [Resource] who log out ...
The audit informations are logged with the 'audit' logger as 'TRACE' level.
Auditor API
Method Description
audit(String message) log the message in 'audit' logger as 'TRACE' level
audit(String messageFormat, Object.. args) log the message (=String.format(messageFormat, args)) in 'audit' logger as 'TRACE' level
